Description: Upper body fragment (?) of a glass flask. Dark blue (?) with opaque white and opaque orange trails. Fragment of upper(?) body; slight concavity in vertical profile. Thick, enamel-like surface-coat, mainly whitish outside, blackened (burnt?) within. Upright-festoon pattern in two colours. Core-formed and tooled, trails marvered and combed.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: Additional bibliography: J. Benson, Berytus XIV (1961), p.39. Murray et al. 1900, 63, 69, 79. Fossing 1940, 29. Astrom 1967, 59 (=id. 1972, 531). Nolte 1968, 119, s.n. 36a (mention only).
Bibliographic references: Glass / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass in the British Museum (21)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.79, Tomb 50 no. 2)
SCE IV/1D / The Swedish Cyprus Expedition. Vol. IV. Part 1D. The Late Cypriot Bronze Age. Other arts and crafts (p.531 (Unclassified))
